results.title: Alcohol in the human body
results.creator_credit: Felix Forsman and Fennada Filmi Junior
results.brief_description: A cartoon showing the impact of alcohol on the nervous system. It portrays sensibly, objectively and lucidly all effects of alcohol in the human body, and the problems these pose in our society. It leaves the viewer to draw his own conclusions.

results.title: Alcohol: how much is too much
results.creator_credit: Alan Capps, Frank Gardonyi, Ingvar Grimsgaard, Lou Lilly, Quartet Films and West
results.brief_description: An open-minded film which discusses social and physiological effects of alcohol. It is particularly designed for elementary grades. The film considers alcohol through such facts as its abuse as a drug, and its physiological effects on the brain and other parts of the human body. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: Alcohol: a new focus
results.creator_credit: Noel Nosseck, American Educational Films and Directions Unlimited
results.brief_description: Points out that everyone, at some time in his life, has to decide whether or not to drink, how much to drink and under what circumstances. Looks at the historical facts of the temperance debate, drinking traditions and effects of alcohol on the body. Builds up a case against unwise drinking habits. Narrated by James Brolin.

results.title: Albury: year round holiday centre
results.brief_description: A look at Albury, holiday and convention city, and its surrounding resorts. Shows the numerous amenities they can offer to the tourist or visitor. Points of interest seen are Lake Hume, Beechworth and its historic buildings and Mount Beauty and skiing at Falls Creek. No further credits available.

results.title: Alberta girls
results.creator_credit: Malca Gillson, Tony Ianzelo, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The film follows the Alberta All-girls drum and bugle band at the opening ceremonies of the World Cup Soccer Championship at Munich, Olympic Stadium, and their tour around Germany.

results.title: Albert Gleizes
results.creator_credit: Pierre Alibert and Les Films du Cypres
results.brief_description: Presents the painter who, early in his career, began experimenting with structure to rediscover form, which eventually led to Cubism. Successive treatments of one subject painted by Gleizes are compared in their cubistic development and the laws of painting, which Gleizes defined, are demonstrated through examples in his own work.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Pierre Alibert and Les Films du Cypres

results.title: On writing
results.creator_credit: Ross Campbell, Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre and Alexander Milsky
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Alan Marshall: author and man”.
Though afflicted by sickness and suffering at an early age, Marshall had a happy childhood. He began to write at the age of ten. He read widely and was influenced by various authors, though his stories usually begin from small everyday incidents or remarks. He offers some advice to young writers.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ross Campbell, Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre and Alexander Milsky

results.title: Life and influences
results.creator_credit: Ross Campbell and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Alan Marshall: author and man”.
Alan Marshall describes his early life, the loneliness because of his handicap, and how he overcame this by faith and determination. He tells in an amusing way how people and incidents gave him a store of material that inspired his creative ability, and shaped his philosophy.
